sections.name: Programming & Technology
sections.description: Mixed questions: MTF-MCQ matching + Normal MCQ about programming and technology

questions.question: How many of the following are correctly matched?
How many of the following are incorrectly matched?
Which programming language is primarily used for web frontend development?
questions.reasoning: JavaScript is the primary language for client-side web development, running in browsers to create interactive user interfaces.

questions.question: What does API stand for in software development?
questions.reasoning: API stands for Application Programming Interface, which defines how different software components should interact with each other.

sections.name: Geography & World Knowledge
sections.description: Mixed questions: MTF-MCQ matching + Normal MCQ about geography and world knowledge

questions.question: How many of the following are correctly matched?
choices: i, iii, iv and v only
questions.answer: i, iii, iv and v only

questions.question: How many of the following are incorrectly matched?
Which is the largest continent by area?
questions.reasoning: Asia is the largest continent, covering about 30% of Earth's total land area and containing about 60% of the world's population.

questions.question: The Amazon River primarily flows through which country?
questions.reasoning: While the Amazon River originates in Peru and flows through several countries, the majority of its length (about 60%) flows through Brazil.

sections.name: Science & Chemistry
sections.description: Mixed questions: MTF-MCQ matching + Normal MCQ about science and chemistry

questions.question: How many of the following are correctly matched?
How many of the following are incorrectly matched?
What is the chemical formula for water?
questions.reasoning: Water is composed of two hydrogen atoms bonded to one oxygen atom, giving it the molecular formula H2O.

questions.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
questions.reasoning: Argon is a noble gas (Group 18 element) that is chemically inert under normal conditions due to its complete electron shell.
